revised_title: Vibronic and Rotational Structure in the Electronic Spectra of Linear Open-Shell Cations
tldr: The article discusses the study of the vibrational and rotational structure of electronic transitions in linear open-shell cations using three complementary techniques: emission spectroscopy with supersonic free jets, laser excitation of fluorescence, and absorption measurements in neon matrices. The techniques are applied to various open-shell organic cations, providing unambiguous vibronic and rotational assignments and paving the way for further research on their electronic structure.
